remarks.format:
## Remarks `subsetToReformatTo` must be compatible with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> used by the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice.GetStylusPoints%28System.Windows.IInputElement%29> method. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription.GetCommonDescription%2A> method to get a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> before calling the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice.GetStylusPoints%28System.Windows.IInputElement%2CSystem.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription%29> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Synchronize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Synchronizes the cursor and the user interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Applications may need to locate the element that the cursor is positioned over. If the application uses animation, the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice.DirectlyOver%2A> method might return an element that has moved out from under the cursor. Call <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice.Synchronize%2A> to be sure that <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice.DirectlyOver%2A> returns the proper element.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to return an element that is under the cursor. Calling <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice.Synchronize%2A> ensures that <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice.DirectlyOver%2A> returns the correct element.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Windows.Input/Stylus/Overview/Window2.xaml.cs" id="Snippet24"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StylusSamples/VisualBasic/Window2.xaml.vb" id="Snippet24"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Windows.Input/Stylus/Overview/Window2.xaml.cs" id="Snippet26"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StylusSamples/VisualBasic/Window2.xaml.vb" id="Snippet26":::
